articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Crispian Balmer, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The U.N. Security Council is also set to vote on a demand for a ceasefire between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas and humanitarian access across Gaza.
articles.title: US signals veto of UN Security Council demand for Gaza ceasefire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military recovered the bodies of two hostages, Judi Weinstein-Haggai and Gad Haggai, who were held by Hamas, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Thursday.
articles.title: Israeli military recovers bodies of two hostages held by Hamas, prime minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian aircraft were damaged but not destroyed in a June 1 attack by Ukraine, and they will be restored, Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said in an interview with the state news agency TASS.
articles.title: Russia says it will repair bombers damaged by Ukraine's drones

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Nandita Bose
articles.description: The proclamation fully restricts the entry of nationals from 12 countries including Afghanistan, Haiti and Iran. The entry of people from seven other countries will be partially restricted.
articles.title: Trump bans nationals from 12 countries, citing security concerns

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Joseph Ax
articles.description: The man charged with fire-bombing a Colorado march by people who wanted to raise awareness of Israeli hostages in Gaza is scheduled to be formally charged in state court on Thursday, as those he targeted vowed to carry on their efforts.
articles.title: Colorado fire-bomb suspect to make court appearance

articles.author: Alexander Villegas, Lucinda Elliott
articles.description: An effort by Chilean President Gabriel Boric to expand abortion rights in the final months of his administration could finally give him a progressive legacy after three years in office but it is an uphill task that Latin American conservatives are hoping will fail as they seek to reverse gains for the abortion rights movement in the region.
articles.title: Chile abortion rights bill could shape Boric legacy as Latin American neighbors look on

articles.author: Rafael Montoto
articles.description: On a Tuesday morning along a busy Mexico City avenue last month, a secretary to the city's mayor pulled her black Audi SUV up to a metro station to pick up a colleague.
articles.title: Brazen murders threaten Mexico City's image as pocket of safety in violent nation

articles.author: Ludwig Burger
articles.description: A Milan-bound Ryanair flight was forced to make an emergency landing in southern Germany late on Wednesday due to heavy turbulence from a thunderstorm, with nine passengers injured, police said.
articles.title: Nine injured in Ryanair emergency landing in Germany

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines and United States militaries have sailed together in the South China Sea for a seventh time to boost interoperability between the two sides, Manila's armed forces said on Thursday.
articles.title: Philippines, U.S., hold joint maritime drills for seventh time

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thailand called on Cambodia to engage positively in efforts to settle a longstanding border dispute, stressing on Thursday it did not recognise the jurisdiction of the International Court of Justice after its neighbour said it would refer the issue to the World Court.
articles.title: Thailand urges positive engagement after Cambodia threatens to take dispute to World Court
